title: Relates to the qualifications of operators of health facilities
summary: Relates to the qualifications of operators of health facilities; requires the consideration of past labor transgressions when granting, renewing, revoking, etc. certificates of operation/applications to hospitals, nursing homes, HMOs, and health care services agencies.

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to the qualifications
         of operators of health facilities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  2801-a  of  the  public health law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 3-b to read as follows:

    4  NITY  UNDER SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION, THE PUBLIC HEALTH COUNCIL

    7  SAFETY, COLLECTIVE BARGAINING OR  ANY  OTHER  LABOR  RELATED  PRACTICES,
    8  OBLIGATIONS OR IMPERATIVES.
    9    S  2. Section 2805 of the public health law is amended by adding a new
   10  subdivision 3 to read as follows:
   11    3. IN DETERMINING WHETHER TO ISSUE OR RENEW AN  OPERATING  CERTIFICATE

   18  subdivision 4 to read as follows:

   21  STATE OR FEDERAL RULES, REGULATIONS OR STATUTES RELATING TO EMPLOYER-EM-
   22  PLOYEE RELATIONS, WORKPLACE SAFETY, COLLECTIVE BARGAINING OR  ANY  OTHER
   23  LABOR RELATED PRACTICES, OBLIGATIONS OR IMPERATIVES.

    8    S 5. Section 2897 of the public health law is amended by adding a  new
    9  subdivision 4 to read as follows:
   10    4.  THE LICENSE OR REGISTRATION OF A NURSING HOME ADMINISTRATOR MAY BE
   11  SUSPENDED FOR A FIXED PERIOD OR REVOKED OR  SUCH  ADMINISTRATOR  MAY  BE
   12  CENSURED, REPRIMANDED, SUBJECTED TO A CIVIL PENALTY AND OTHERWISE DISCI-
   13  PLINED  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS AND PROCEDURES DEFINED IN THIS

   15  NURSING HOME HE OR SHE HAS INTENTIONALLY PARTICIPATED IN ANY ACT,  PRAC-

   26  ANY OTHER LABOR RELATED PRACTICES, OBLIGATIONS OR IMPERATIVES.
